data: Amid the first hard winds of winter, the King of Kings of Bassania, Shirvan the Great, Brother to the Sun and Moons, Sword of Perun, Scourge of Black Azal, left his walled city of Kabadh and journeyed south and west with much of his court to examine the state of his fortifications in that part of the lands he ruled, to sacrifice at the ancient Holy Fire of the priestly caste, and to hunt lions in the desert.
King of Kings of Bassania | Brother to the Sun and Moons | Sword of Perun | Scourge of Black Azal | Kabadh | Holy Fire
Guy Gavriel Kay|Guy Gavriel Kay (Goodreads Author)
